{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3125329,"name":"Elliot Scher","username":"Gandagorn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gandagorn/{size}/267112_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-13T17:02:58.618Z","cooked":"

So I’ve imaged our limelight with the new version of photonvision using balena etcher but I’m not able to connect to the https://photonvision.local url.

The limelight is plugged into the pdp on a 20A breaker and the ethernet cable is plugged into the secondary port on the robot’s radio.

What am I doing wrong? Thanks!!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2023-01-13T17:02:58.618Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":179,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":924.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":422916,"topic_slug":"limelight-with-photonvision-not-connecting","display_username":"Elliot Scher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://photonvision.local","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":5},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/unable-to-connect-to-photonvision/422987/3","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Unable to connect to Photonvision","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-with-photonvision-not-connecting/422916/1","custom_user_title":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3125338,"name":"","username":"mdurrani834","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mdurrani834/{size}/131246_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-13T17:12:56.856Z","cooked":"

This is a known issue that we’re working to fix right now. A known workaround is using a network switch.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2023-01-13T17:12:56.856Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":143,"readers_count":142,"score":63.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":422916,"topic_slug":"limelight-with-photonvision-not-connecting","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":34970,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/limelight-with-photonvision-not-connecting/422916/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3125348,"name":"Amicus1","username":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-13T17:18:33.792Z","cooked":"

Don’t use the secondary port of the radio. It is known to be effectively nonfunctional. You need a network switch.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2023-01-13T17:18:33.792Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":133,"readers_count":132,"score":116.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":422916,"topic_slug":"limelight-with-photonvision-not-connecting","display_username":"Amicus1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-with-photonvision-not-connecting/422916/3","custom_user_title":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3125351,"name":"","username":"Akash_Rastogi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-13T17:21:41.752Z","cooked":"

100% use a network switch. I highly recommend BrainBox

Based on the link, I would say it would not work. It’s not a switch.

From the Amazon page

This won’t work assuming you want to use all three ports at once. You want a “network switch” or “ethernet switch” which will allow you to use all of the ports at once. I’ll second the recommendation for the Brainboxes switches, specifically SW-005 or SW-008.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2023-01-14T01:46:46.147Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":86,"readers_count":85,"score":62.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":422916,"topic_slug":"limelight-with-photonvision-not-connecting","display_username":"Ari Meles-Braverman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":49423,"username":"Gandagorn","name":"Elliot Scher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gandagorn/{size}/267112_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25012,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-with-photonvision-not-connecting/422916/9","custom_user_title":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3125811,"name":"billbo911","username":"billbo911","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billbo911/{size}/110890_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-14T02:07:08.358Z","cooked":"

Nope, that is a Hub, not a Switch.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2023-01-14T02:07:08.358Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":79,"readers_count":78,"score":15.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":422916,"topic_slug":"limelight-with-photonvision-not-connecting","display_username":"billbo911","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":49423,"username":"Gandagorn","name":"Elliot Scher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gandagorn/{size}/267112_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"KN6MPS, WRWZ842"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-with-photonvision-not-connecting/422916/10","custom_user_title":"KN6MPS, WRWZ842","reactions":[{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3125942,"name":"Alex","username":"ajs2","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ajs2/{size}/200927_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-14T04:15:34.180Z","cooked":"

Use an ethernet switch.
There are many known issues with using the two ports on the radio (long story short, there’s a silicon-level bug that causes the coupling of the two ethernet ports to be unreliable). Many teams have had success with the Brainboxes SW-005 switch - it can be powered off one of the low-current channels on your PDH, and is easily mountable. You can use your team’s Digi-Key voucher from the virtual Kit of Parts on it.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2023-01-14T04:15:34.180Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":75,"readers_count":74,"score":50.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":422916,"topic_slug":"limelight-with-photonvision-not-connecting","display_username":"Alex","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.digikey.com/en/products/detail/brainboxes/SW-005/10707220","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":6},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/why-you-probably-shouldnt-use-the-second-port-on-your-openmesh-om5p-radio-and-embrace-using-an-ethernet-switch-instead/406374","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Why you probably shouldn't use the second port on your OpenMesh OM5P Radio and embrace using an Ethernet Switch instead","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56260,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6238 alum (he/they)"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-with-photonvision-not-connecting/422916/12","custom_user_title":"6238 alum (he/they)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3125969,"name":"Elliot Scher","username":"Gandagorn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gandagorn/{size}/267112_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-14T05:14:41.518Z","cooked":"

I found a 5 port Netgear switch kicking around. Would that work?

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2023-01-14T05:14:41.518Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":67,"readers_count":66,"score":28.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":422916,"topic_slug":"limelight-with-photonvision-not-connecting","display_username":"Elliot Scher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56260,"username":"ajs2","name":"Alex","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ajs2/{size}/200927_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-with-photonvision-not-connecting/422916/13","custom_user_title":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3125974,"name":"Alex","username":"ajs2","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ajs2/{size}/200927_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-14T05:26:57.370Z","cooked":"

Yes, if it’s powered by 12 or 18 volt “passive” PoE or with a 12 or 5 volt barrel jack. It should say on the label what it takes. It also can’t output “standard” or “active” PoE because that’s too high a voltage. R203.i limits all circuitry used on the robot to a maximum 24 volts, and standard PoE is about 44 volts.

He ac adapter says it takes 12 v at 0.7A. can I power that off the vrm?

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2023-01-14T05:40:31.855Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":14,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":58,"readers_count":57,"score":16.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":422916,"topic_slug":"limelight-with-photonvision-not-connecting","display_username":"Elliot Scher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56260,"username":"ajs2","name":"Alex","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ajs2/{size}/200927_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-with-photonvision-not-connecting/422916/15","custom_user_title":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3125982,"name":"Alex","username":"ajs2","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ajs2/{size}/200927_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-14T05:44:37.696Z","cooked":"

Yes, on the 12V 2A channels. However, if you’re using a PoE injector for the radio, they can’t be on the same VRM - the radio needs to be the only thing on the 12V 2A channels of its VRM.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2023-01-14T13:27:54.884Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":16,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":46,"readers_count":45,"score":14.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":422916,"topic_slug":"limelight-with-photonvision-not-connecting","display_username":"Elliot Scher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56260,"username":"ajs2","name":"Alex","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ajs2/{size}/200927_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-with-photonvision-not-connecting/422916/17","custom_user_title":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3126167,"name":"Alex","username":"ajs2","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ajs2/{size}/200927_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-14T17:06:35.984Z","cooked":"

It’s a rule, specifically R616, which reads:

R616 *Power radio as specified – Part 1. The wireless bridge (radio) power must be supplied by either:
A. the 12V 2A output of a CTR Electronics Voltage Regulator Module (VRM) (P/N am-2857, 217-4245), as shown in Figure 9-13, and must be the only load connected to those terminals…
